  • वित्तीय सहायता:
    • सरकारी एजेंसियों के लिए 1 करोड़ रुपये।
    • निजी संगठनों के लिए 75 लाख रुपये, जिसमें पूंजीगत व्यय का 25% आवेदक द्वारा वहन किया जाएगा।
  • मुख्य उद्देश्य:
    • कृषि-ग्रामीण क्षेत्र में नवाचार और रोजगार को बढ़ावा देना।
    • ग्रामीण विकास के लिए स्केलेबल सूक्ष्म उद्यम बनाना।
  • पात्रता:
    • प्रासंगिक विशेषज्ञता वाले सरकारी संस्थान, राज्य विभाग, उद्योग संघ और गैर-लाभकारी संगठन।
125
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
सीजेआई संजीव खन्ना के सेवानिवृत्त होने के बाद 52वें भारत के मुख्य न्यायाधीश के रूप में किसे नियुक्त किया गया है?
न्यायमूर्ति संजय किशन कौल
न्यायमूर्ति एस अब्दुल नजीर
जस्टिस भूषण रामकृष्ण गवई
न्यायमूर्ति अभय एस. ओका
न्यायमूर्ति अरुण कुमार
Solution

सही उत्तर न्यायमूर्ति बी आर गवई है।

In News

  • मुख्य न्यायाधीश संजीव खन्ना ने न्यायमूर्ति बी आर गवई को अपना उत्तराधिकारी नामित किया, जो सरकारी अनुमोदन के बाद भारत के 52वें मुख्य न्यायाधीश बनेंगे।

Key Points

  • न्यायमूर्ति बी आर गवई वर्तमान में सर्वोच्च न्यायालय में दूसरे सबसे वरिष्ठ न्यायाधीश हैं।
  • उन्हें 24 मई, 2019 को सर्वोच्च न्यायालय में पदोन्नत किया गया था।
  • वे सीजेआई खन्ना के 13 मई, 2025 को सेवानिवृत्त होने के बाद पदभार ग्रहण करेंगे।
  • वे 23 नवंबर, 2025 तक पद पर रहेंगे।

Additional Information

  • न्यायमूर्ति बी आर गवई
    • अमरावती, महाराष्ट्र के रहने वाले हैं।
    • मुद्रीकरण, अनुच्छेद 370 के निरसन और चुनावी बॉन्ड के फैसले सहित प्रमुख फैसलों का हिस्सा रहे हैं।
    • वास्तविक समानता के लिए अनुसूचित जातियों/अनुसूचित जनजातियों के लिए क्रीमी लेयर सिद्धांत लागू करने की वकालत की।
  • न्यायमूर्ति संजय किशन कौल
    • हाल ही में दिसंबर 2023 में सर्वोच्च न्यायालय से सेवानिवृत्त हुए।
  • न्यायमूर्ति डी वाई चंद्रचूड़
    • भारत के 50वें मुख्य न्यायाधीश के रूप में कार्य किया।
  • न्यायमूर्ति एस अब्दुल नजीर
    • अयोध्या फैसले में अपनी भूमिका के लिए जाने जाते हैं, 2023 में सेवानिवृत्त हुए।
126
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
150 मिलियन डॉलर जुटाने और 1 बिलियन डॉलर के मूल्यांकन के बाद 2025 का पहला यूनिकॉर्न बनने वाली फिनटेक इन्फ्रास्ट्रक्चर कंपनी का नाम बताइए।
Razorpay
Paytm
Juspay
PhonePe
ZapPay
Solution

सही उत्तर Juspay है।

In News

  • 150 मिलियन डॉलर जुटाने और 1 बिलियन डॉलर के मूल्यांकन के बाद Juspay 2025 का पहला यूनिकॉर्न बनने वाली है।

Key Points

  • 2012 में विमल कुमार और शीतल ललवानी द्वारा स्थापित, Juspay भुगतान ऑर्केस्ट्रेशन सॉफ्टवेयर में विशेषज्ञता रखती है।
  • कंपनी ने भारतीय राष्ट्रीय भुगतान निगम के लिए BHIM UPI ऐप विकसित करने में महत्वपूर्ण भूमिका निभाई।
  • Juspay का राजस्व वित्त वर्ष 24 में ₹319.32 करोड़ हो गया, जो पिछले वर्ष की तुलना में 49.6% अधिक है।
  • इसे फरवरी 2024 में भुगतान एग्रीगेटर (PA) के रूप में संचालित करने के लिए RBI से अनुमोदन प्राप्त हुआ।

Additional Information

  • Paytm
    • भारत की सबसे बड़ी डिजिटल भुगतान कंपनियों में से एक, लेकिन 2025 का पहला यूनिकॉर्न नहीं।
  • Razorpay
    • एक प्रमुख भुगतान गेटवे कंपनी, लेकिन नवीनतम यूनिकॉर्न फंडिंग राउंड का हिस्सा नहीं।
  • Cashfree
    • एक अन्य भुगतान समाधान प्रदाता, लेकिन 2025 में 150 मिलियन डॉलर जुटाने वाली कंपनी नहीं।
127
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
भारत के किस राज्य को पिछड़े जिलों में आर्थिक विकास को बढ़ावा देने के लिए विश्व बैंक से 188.28 मिलियन डॉलर का ऋण मिला?
गुजरात
महाराष्ट्र
उत्तरप्रदेश 
बिहार
मध्य प्रदेश
Solution

सही उत्तर महाराष्ट्र है।

In News

  • विश्व बैंक ने महाराष्ट्र के पिछड़े जिलों में आर्थिक विकास को बढ़ावा देने के लिए 188.28 मिलियन डॉलर के ऋण को मंजूरी दी।
  • यह ऋण **अंतर्राष्ट्रीय पुनर्निर्माण एवं विकास बैंक (IBRD)** द्वारा प्रदान किया जाता है और इसकी परिपक्वता अवधि **15 वर्ष** है, जिसमें **पांच वर्ष की छूट अवधि** भी शामिल है।**

Key Points

  • इस पहल का उद्देश्य महाराष्ट्र के पिछड़े क्षेत्रों में जिला स्तरीय योजना और विकास रणनीतियों को बढ़ाना है।
  • इस ऋण से राज्य के आर्थिक विकास में सुधार तथा अविकसित क्षेत्रों के उत्थान की आशा है।

Additional Information

  • अंतर्राष्ट्रीय पुनर्निर्माण एवं विकास बैंक (IBRD):
    • **विश्व बैंक समूह** की एक सदस्य संस्था है।**
    • विकास कार्यक्रमों के लिए विकासशील देशों को वित्तीय और तकनीकी सहायता प्रदान करता है।
  • महाराष्ट्र की विकास पहल:
    • यह परियोजना राज्य के भीतर आर्थिक असमानताओं को पाटने के लिए पिछड़े जिलों के उत्थान पर केंद्रित है।
128
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s

जनवरी 2025 में शुरू की गई टीम पहल के संबंध में निम्नलिखित कथनों पर विचार करें:

  1. टीम पहल एमएसएमई मंत्रालय द्वारा ओपन नेटवर्क फॉर डिजिटल कॉमर्स (ओएनडीसी) के सहयोग से 3 वर्षों में कुल 277.35 करोड़ रुपये के परिव्यय के साथ शुरू की गई थी।

  2. यह पहल डिजिटल एमएसएमई योजना के अंतर्गत एक स्वतंत्र कार्यक्रम है और इसका उद्देश्य महानगरों के 1 लाख एमएसएमई को शामिल करना है।

  3. यह आरएएमपी कार्यक्रम के अंतर्गत एक उप-योजना है और इसका लक्ष्य 5 लाख लघु और सूक्ष्म उद्यमों को शामिल करना है, जिसमें 50% महिला-नेतृत्व वाले व्यवसाय शामिल हैं।

उपरोक्त में से कौन से कथन सही हैं?

केवल 1 और 2
केवल 1 और 3
केवल 2 और 3
केवल 3
सभी सही हैं
Solution

सही उत्तर केवल 1 और 3 है।

In News

  • 28 जनवरी, 2025 को, सूक्ष्म, लघु और मध्यम उद्यम मंत्रालय (MoMSME) ने ONDC के सहयोग से व्यापार सक्षमता और विपणन (TEAM) पहल शुरू की।
  • इस कार्यक्रम का बजट तीन वर्षों में 277.35 करोड़ रुपये है और इसका उद्देश्य 5 लाख लघु और सूक्ष्म उद्यमों को शामिल करना है, जिसमें 50% महिला-नेतृत्व वाले व्यवसाय शामिल हैं।

Key Points

  • टीम पहल आरएएमपी (रेजिंग एंड एक्सेलरेटिंग एमएसएमई परफॉर्मेंस) कार्यक्रम के अंतर्गत एक उप-योजना है।
  • यह विशेष रूप से टियर 2 और टियर 3 शहरों में महिला-स्वामित्व वाले उद्यमों को ONDC पर उनके डिजिटल ऑनबोर्डिंग की सुविधा प्रदान करके एमएसएमई का समर्थन करता है।
  • यह पहल लॉजिस्टिक्स, पैकेजिंग, डिज़ाइन, कैटलॉग तैयार करना, खाता प्रबंधन और डिजिटल स्टोरफ्रंट सहायता प्रदान करती है।

Additional Information

  • एमएसएमई मंत्रालय: केंद्रीय मंत्री - जितन राम मांझी (गया, बिहार); राज्य मंत्री - शोभा करंदलाजे
  • ONDC: 2021 में वाणिज्य और उद्योग मंत्रालय, DPIIT द्वारा लॉन्च किया गया; गैर-कार्यकारी अध्यक्ष - राम सेवक शर्मा; मुख्यालय - नई दिल्ली
  • टीम पहल स्टार्टअप इंडिया, पीएम विश्वकर्मा योजना और डिजिटल एमएसएमई योजना जैसी मौजूदा योजनाओं का पूरक है।
129
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s

निम्नलिखित में से कौन सी अर्थशोधन की परतें कौनसी हैं?

i) इन्टिग्रेशन 

ii) ग्राफ्टिंग

iii) सिंक्रनाइज़ेशन

iv) लेयरिंग

v) प्लेसमेंट

सिर्फ i, ii, v
सिर्फ i, iii, iv
सिर्फ ii, iii, iv
सिर्फ i, iv, v
सिर्फ iii, iv, v
Solution

अर्थशोधन की तीन परतें हैं - प्लेसमेंट, लेयरिंग और इन्टिग्रेशन।

प्लेसमेंट अर्थशोधन का पहला चरण है जहां आपराधिक गतिविधि में शामिल नकदी वित्तीय प्रणाली में प्रवेश करती है।

लेयरिंग अर्थशोधन का दूसरा चरण है जहां वित्तीय लेनदेन के माध्यम से अपने अवैध स्रोत से प्राप्त धन को दूर करने के प्रयास किए जाते हैं।

अर्थशोधन का तीसरा चरण इन्टिग्रेशन है। इस चरण में धन के लिए वैध स्पष्टीकरण प्रदान कर अवैध आय का वैध व्यवसाय में पुन: समावेशन किया जाता है।

130
General/ Economy/ Banking Awareness
+0.5s, -0.125s
भारतीय नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा विकास एजेंसी (IREDA) का शुद्ध लाभ वित्त वर्ष 2024-25 की चौथी तिमाही में 49% बढ़कर ₹502 करोड़ हो गया, जो पिछले वर्ष की समान तिमाही में ₹337 करोड़ था। IREDA किसके प्रशासनिक नियंत्रण में काम करता है?
विद्युत मंत्रालय
भारी उद्योग मंत्रालय
नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा और नवीन ऊर्जा मंत्रालय
पर्यावरण, वन और जलवायु परिवर्तन मंत्रालय
इनमे से कोई भी नहीं
Solution

सही उत्तर नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा और नवीन ऊर्जा मंत्रालय है।

In News

  • IREDA ने पिछले वर्ष की समान तिमाही में ₹337 करोड़ की तुलना में वित्त वर्ष 2024-25 की चौथी तिमाही में 49% की वृद्धि के साथ ₹502 करोड़ का शुद्ध लाभ दर्ज किया।
  • इस तिमाही में कंपनी का राजस्व 37.7% बढ़कर ₹1,392 करोड़ हो गया, और ऋण स्वीकृति 27% बढ़कर कुल ₹47,453 करोड़ हो गई।
  • IREDA ने अपनी वैश्विक उपस्थिति को मजबूत करने के लिए SBI टोक्यो के साथ 26 बिलियन जापानी येन के ऋण समझौते पर हस्ताक्षर किए।

Key Points

  • IREDA नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा और नवीन ऊर्जा मंत्रालय (MNRE) के प्रशासनिक नियंत्रण में कार्य करता है।
  • यह एक सार्वजनिक क्षेत्र का उद्यम और एक अग्रणी हरित वित्तपोषण NBFC है।
  • IREDA को अप्रैल 2024 में लोक उद्यम विभाग द्वारा “नवरत्न” का दर्जा दिया गया था।
  • एजेंसी नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा और ऊर्जा दक्षता परियोजनाओं के लिए वित्तीय सहायता प्रदान करती है।

Additional Information

  • IREDA
    • 1987 में स्थापित और मुख्यालय इंडिया हैबिटेट सेंटर, नई दिल्ली में है।
    • नवंबर 2023 में NSE और BSE पर सूचीबद्ध IPO के माध्यम से सार्वजनिक हुआ।
    • वित्त वर्ष 2024-25 तक कुल संपत्ति: ₹79,734 करोड़।
    • अंतर्राष्ट्रीय परिचालन को मजबूत करने के लिए SBI टोक्यो शाखा के साथ 26 बिलियन येन के ऋण समझौते पर हस्ताक्षर किए।
  • नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा और नवीन ऊर्जा मंत्रालय (MNRE)
    • नवीकरणीय ऊर्जा संसाधनों के विकास और परिनियोजन के लिए जिम्मेदार है।
    • भारत के हरित ऊर्जा लक्ष्यों का समर्थन करने के लिए IREDA जैसे सार्वजनिक क्षेत्र के निकायों का प्रशासन करता है।
131

+0.5s, -0.125s

I) This balancing act forced her (A)/ to do much of her (B)/ own work from midnight (C)/ to five in the morning. (D)
II) Emphasis was laid on (A)/ four southwestern states (B)/ in Nigeria to determine the (C)/ survivals of informal business. (D)
III) That was a good finish (A)/ and it was nice to see that he (B)/ wasn't put of by (C)/ his earlier miss. (D)

III-C and II-D
I-D and III-C
II-A and I-B
III-B and II-A
I-A and II-C

English Language

Directions: In the following passage, some words have been deleted. Each question will present three words (I, II, and III) that can fill the blanks. Choose the option containing the word(s) that correctly fills the blanks to complete the passage.

Four centuries ago, a woman named Else Knutsdatter was executed in Vardø, a small coastal town in Norway. She was accused of having used witchcraft to raise an ocean storm that claimed the lives of 40 men. She wasn’t the only one to fall victim to 17th-century folk who – in the ______ (A) of other explanations – could be convinced that disasters were conjured by malevolent sorcerers. Ninety others were executed for conspiring to produce the same storm.Today, we know that physics and atmospheric pressures produced those storms. So, in the realm of weather, we’ve moved to systemic thinking, where bad things don’t need to be explained with ______ (B) to bad actors. When it comes to descriptions of politics and economics, the progress is not so unequivocal. Do bad things like climate change, conflict and corporate greed happen because powerful politicians and CEOs construct it like that, or do they emerge in the vacuum of human agency, in the fact that nobody’s actually in ______ (C)? This is a question that confronts me in the campaign to protect the physical cash system against the digital takeover by Big Finance and Big Tech.
For more than eight years, I’ve advocated for the protection and promotion of physical notes and coins. I wrote a book called Cloudmoney: Why the War on Cash Endangers Our Freedom (2023). In that book, I point out that the public has swallowed a false just-so story that says we are ______ (D) for a cashless society. All over the world, public and private sector leaders claim that ‘our’ desire for speed, convenience, scale and interconnection drives an inevitable digital transition. This is supposed to bring a ‘frictionless’ world of digital payment-fuelled commerce, done at the click of a button or scan of the iris. The message is: keep up or else face being left ______ (E).

Which of the following word(s) can fill in the blank labelled as (A) in the passage?

I. absence
II. presence
III. arrival

Only I
Only II
Only III
Both II & III
Both I & II

+0.5s, -0.125s

144
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Below a paragraph is given followed by five sentences. Identify which sentence/s can be the correct sentence of the paragraph to make the paragraph completed and coherent.

For many years it has been recognized that media reporting of mental illness is heavily biased in representing a misleading link between mental illness and violence, with preferential reporting for sensationalist stories depicting individuals with mental disorders as being aggressive, dangerous, and unpredictable. (.................). Of particular concern is the potential ‘internalization’ of prejudices portrayed by the media, such that people with mental illnesses also begin to take on the view that they are dangerous and unstable. Furthermore, there is a corresponding lack of voice for people of mental illness, with few personal accounts of their burden of disease and similarly little representation from qualified healthcare professionals. All of this contributes to creating a stereotyped, isolated group without social status and acceptance

Despite several prominent government-led and charity campaigns, mental illness and individuals with mental illness continue to experience stigmatization and stereotyping. 
In a similar vein, there is a disappointing lack of coverage of stories on recovery and rehabilitation following mental illness.
Such widespread negative portrayals have reinforced the continued stigmatization and lack of acceptance among those with psychiatric diagnoses, possibly increasing social distance and contributing to morbidity and distress
The particular reasons for the ongoing negative headlines about mental illness, and what could or should be done about them, are beyond the scope of this study.
The reporting of mental illness and people with mental illness tended to be negative, whereas that of physical illness was much more likely to be positive in tone.
145
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Below a paragraph is given followed by five sentences. Identify which sentence/s can be the correct sentence of the paragraph to make the paragraph completed and coherent.

The only way to get through obstacles is to start by acknowledging that they're there. The gateway to your feelings and emotions is your thoughts. What you think about and focus on is what you'll attract more of into your life. When you're dealing with obstacles, your thoughts focus on what you can't control and why that situation is happening to you. That can be a dark place. (....................). When you try to suppress them, they grow stronger and threaten to get control. Once you have given yourself two minutes, take control of your thoughts. Focus on what brings you joy and what you're grateful for in your life. It's hard to be down when you're expressing gratitude.

Obstacles don't have to be business breakers in your life. You can learn from them and use them to make you a stronger and wiser entrepreneur.
When you feel your thoughts spiralling, give yourself two minutes to fully feel what is going on in your head. Don't try to suppress those thoughts -- let them out. 
During the hard times, negative feelings and emotions can easily take over. Before you know it, you're feeling sorry for yourself and you turn to your familiar coping mechanism.
You won’t seek out the things that truly help your business experience explosive results because all those things require you stretching yourself.
Focus can change your life dramatically. When you focus on your life to make it better, it will start to get better eventually.
146
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

The stroke of midnight, August 15, 1947, heralded the birth of two independent nations, India and Pakistan, carved out of the departing British Raj. Yet, this moment of triumph was inextricably intertwined with the agonising trauma of Partition. The Radcliffe Line, hastily drawn and based on inadequate demographic data, arbitrarily bisected provinces, communities, and even families, unleashing a maelstrom of violence, displacement, and enduring psychological scars. The immediate aftermath witnessed one of the largest forced migrations in human history. Millions of Hindus, Sikhs, and Muslims found themselves on the "wrong" side of the newly drawn border, compelled to abandon their ancestral homes and embark on perilous journeys to their perceived homelands. Trains became charnel houses, filled with the mutilated bodies of those targeted in the communal frenzy that gripped the subcontinent. Stories of unimaginable brutality – massacres, abduction, and sexual violence – became the horrific currency of this unprecedented upheaval, leaving an indelible mark on the collective psyche of generations to come.
Beyond the immediate bloodshed, the legacy of Partition continues to manifest in complex and often contentious ways. The arbitrary division sowed the seeds of enduring geopolitical rivalry between India and Pakistan, marked by territorial disputes, proxy wars, and a persistent climate of mistrust. The unresolved issue of Kashmir remains a potent flashpoint, a constant reminder of ________________. Furthermore, within the successor states, the narratives of Partition remain deeply fragmented and often politicised. Official histories frequently emphasise nationalistic perspectives, often downplaying or selectively highlighting the violence and suffering experienced by certain communities. Subaltern voices, particularly those of women and marginalised groups who bore a disproportionate burden of the violence, have historically been silenced or relegated to the periphery. The intergenerational trauma, passed down through families and communities, continues to influence social relations and individual identities. The Partition era also left behind a complex tapestry of cultural and linguistic fragmentation. Shared histories and intertwined traditions were abruptly severed. The loss of heritage, the destruction of cultural artefacts, and the forced separation of artistic and intellectual communities had a profound impact on the cultural landscape of the subcontinent. The debates surrounding national identity in both India and Pakistan are still deeply influenced by the experience of Partition and the need to reconcile competing narratives of belonging and victimhood. Understanding the complexities of Partition requires moving beyond simplistic narratives of victim and perpetrator. It demands a critical engagement with the diverse experiences of those who lived through it, acknowledging the multifaceted nature of the violence and its long-term consequences. Examining personal testimonies, oral histories, and marginalised perspectives offers crucial insights into the human cost of political decisions and the enduring shadow that Partition continues to cast over the Indian subcontinent. The process of acknowledging and confronting this painful past remains essential for fostering reconciliation and building a more inclusive future.
According to the passage, which of the following has not been cited as one of the complex and contentious ways in which the legacy of Partition continues to manifest?
Territorial disputes between India and Pakistan.
Proxy wars fuelled by geopolitical rivalries.
Continued peaceful integration of diverse communities across borders.
Persistent climate of mistrust between the two nations.
The unresolved issue of Kashmir.
147
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

It demands a critical engagement with the diverse experiences of those who lived through it, acknowledging the multifaceted nature of the violence and its long-term consequences. Examining personal testimonies, oral histories, and marginalised perspectives offers crucial insights into the human cost of political decisions and the enduring shadow that Partition continues to cast over the Indian subcontinent. The process of acknowledging and confronting this painful past remains essential for fostering reconciliation and building a more inclusive future.
The passage states that the Radcliffe Line was hastily drawn and based on inadequate demographic data, leading to which of the following outcomes?
Equitable distribution of resources.
Peaceful coexistence among diverse communities.
Accurate and just demarcation of borders.
Violence, displacement, and psychological scars.
Strengthened cultural ties between newly formed nations.
148
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

The stroke of midnight, August 15, 1947, heralded the birth of two independent nations, India and Pakistan, carved out of the departing British Raj. Yet, this moment of triumph was inextricably intertwined with the agonising trauma of Partition. The Radcliffe Line, hastily drawn and based on inadequate demographic data, arbitrarily bisected provinces, communities, and even families, unleashing a maelstrom of violence, displacement, and enduring psychological scars. The immediate aftermath witnessed one of the largest forced migrations in human history. Millions of Hindus, Sikhs, and Muslims found themselves on the "wrong" side of the newly drawn border, compelled to abandon their ancestral homes and embark on perilous journeys to their perceived homelands. Trains became charnel houses, filled with the mutilated bodies of those targeted in the communal frenzy that gripped the subcontinent. Stories of unimaginable brutality – massacres, abduction, and sexual violence – became the horrific currency of this unprecedented upheaval, leaving an indelible mark on the collective psyche of generations to come.
Beyond the immediate bloodshed, the legacy of Partition continues to manifest in complex and often contentious ways. The arbitrary division sowed the seeds of enduring geopolitical rivalry between India and Pakistan, marked by territorial disputes, proxy wars, and a persistent climate of mistrust. The unresolved issue of Kashmir remains a potent flashpoint, a constant reminder of ________________. Furthermore, within the successor states, the narratives of Partition remain deeply fragmented and often politicised. Official histories frequently emphasise nationalistic perspectives, often downplaying or selectively highlighting the violence and suffering experienced by certain communities. Subaltern voices, particularly those of women and marginalised groups who bore a disproportionate burden of the violence, have historically been silenced or relegated to the periphery. The intergenerational trauma, passed down through families and communities, continues to influence social relations and individual identities. The Partition era also left behind a complex tapestry of cultural and linguistic fragmentation. Shared histories and intertwined traditions were abruptly severed. The loss of heritage, the destruction of cultural artefacts, and the forced separation of artistic and intellectual communities had a profound impact on the cultural landscape of the subcontinent. The debates surrounding national identity in both India and Pakistan are still deeply influenced by the experience of Partition and the need to reconcile competing narratives of belonging and victimhood. Understanding the complexities of Partition requires moving beyond simplistic narratives of victim and perpetrator. It demands a critical engagement with the diverse experiences of those who lived through it, acknowledging the multifaceted nature of the violence and its long-term consequences. Examining personal testimonies, oral histories, and marginalised perspectives offers crucial insights into the human cost of political decisions and the enduring shadow that Partition continues to cast over the Indian subcontinent. The process of acknowledging and confronting this painful past remains essential for fostering reconciliation and building a more inclusive future.
What will fit in the blank taken from the passage: ‘The unresolved issue of Kashmir remains a potent flashpoint, a constant reminder of ________________.'
the peaceful transition to independence
the unfinished business of Partition and the human cost of hastily drawn borders
the successful collaboration between India and Pakistan
the harmonious coexistence fostered by Partition
the triumph of democratic principles in the region
149
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

The stroke of midnight, August 15, 1947, heralded the birth of two independent nations, India and Pakistan, carved out of the departing British Raj. Yet, this moment of triumph was inextricably intertwined with the agonising trauma of Partition. The Radcliffe Line, hastily drawn and based on inadequate demographic data, arbitrarily bisected provinces, communities, and even families, unleashing a maelstrom of violence, displacement, and enduring psychological scars. The immediate aftermath witnessed one of the largest forced migrations in human history. Millions of Hindus, Sikhs, and Muslims found themselves on the "wrong" side of the newly drawn border, compelled to abandon their ancestral homes and embark on perilous journeys to their perceived homelands. Trains became charnel houses, filled with the mutilated bodies of those targeted in the communal frenzy that gripped the subcontinent. Stories of unimaginable brutality – massacres, abduction, and sexual violence – became the horrific currency of this unprecedented upheaval, leaving an indelible mark on the collective psyche of generations to come.
Beyond the immediate bloodshed, the legacy of Partition continues to manifest in complex and often contentious ways. The arbitrary division sowed the seeds of enduring geopolitical rivalry between India and Pakistan, marked by territorial disputes, proxy wars, and a persistent climate of mistrust. The unresolved issue of Kashmir remains a potent flashpoint, a constant reminder of ________________. Furthermore, within the successor states, the narratives of Partition remain deeply fragmented and often politicised. Official histories frequently emphasise nationalistic perspectives, often downplaying or selectively highlighting the violence and suffering experienced by certain communities. Subaltern voices, particularly those of women and marginalised groups who bore a disproportionate burden of the violence, have historically been silenced or relegated to the periphery. The intergenerational trauma, passed down through families and communities, continues to influence social relations and individual identities. The Partition era also left behind a complex tapestry of cultural and linguistic fragmentation. Shared histories and intertwined traditions were abruptly severed. The loss of heritage, the destruction of cultural artefacts, and the forced separation of artistic and intellectual communities had a profound impact on the cultural landscape of the subcontinent. The debates surrounding national identity in both India and Pakistan are still deeply influenced by the experience of Partition and the need to reconcile competing narratives of belonging and victimhood. Understanding the complexities of Partition requires moving beyond simplistic narratives of victim and perpetrator. It demands a critical engagement with the diverse experiences of those who lived through it, acknowledging the multifaceted nature of the violence and its long-term consequences. Examining personal testimonies, oral histories, and marginalised perspectives offers crucial insights into the human cost of political decisions and the enduring shadow that Partition continues to cast over the Indian subcontinent. The process of acknowledging and confronting this painful past remains essential for fostering reconciliation and building a more inclusive future.
What is the tone of the passage regarding the effects of Partition on India and Pakistan?
Optimistic and celebratory
Neutral and detached
Somber and critical
Sarcastic and dismissive
Light-hearted and humorous
150
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

The stroke of midnight, August 15, 1947, heralded the birth of two independent nations, India and Pakistan, carved out of the departing British Raj. Yet, this moment of triumph was inextricably intertwined with the agonising trauma of Partition. The Radcliffe Line, hastily drawn and based on inadequate demographic data, arbitrarily bisected provinces, communities, and even families, unleashing a maelstrom of violence, displacement, and enduring psychological scars. The immediate aftermath witnessed one of the largest forced migrations in human history. Millions of Hindus, Sikhs, and Muslims found themselves on the "wrong" side of the newly drawn border, compelled to abandon their ancestral homes and embark on perilous journeys to their perceived homelands. Trains became charnel houses, filled with the mutilated bodies of those targeted in the communal frenzy that gripped the subcontinent. Stories of unimaginable brutality – massacres, abduction, and sexual violence – became the horrific currency of this unprecedented upheaval, leaving an indelible mark on the collective psyche of generations to come.
Beyond the immediate bloodshed, the legacy of Partition continues to manifest in complex and often contentious ways. The arbitrary division sowed the seeds of enduring geopolitical rivalry between India and Pakistan, marked by territorial disputes, proxy wars, and a persistent climate of mistrust. The unresolved issue of Kashmir remains a potent flashpoint, a constant reminder of ________________. Furthermore, within the successor states, the narratives of Partition remain deeply fragmented and often politicised. Official histories frequently emphasise nationalistic perspectives, often downplaying or selectively highlighting the violence and suffering experienced by certain communities. Subaltern voices, particularly those of women and marginalised groups who bore a disproportionate burden of the violence, have historically been silenced or relegated to the periphery. The intergenerational trauma, passed down through families and communities, continues to influence social relations and individual identities. The Partition era also left behind a complex tapestry of cultural and linguistic fragmentation. Shared histories and intertwined traditions were abruptly severed. The loss of heritage, the destruction of cultural artefacts, and the forced separation of artistic and intellectual communities had a profound impact on the cultural landscape of the subcontinent. The debates surrounding national identity in both India and Pakistan are still deeply influenced by the experience of Partition and the need to reconcile competing narratives of belonging and victimhood. Understanding the complexities of Partition requires moving beyond simplistic narratives of victim and perpetrator. It demands a critical engagement with the diverse experiences of those who lived through it, acknowledging the multifaceted nature of the violence and its long-term consequences. Examining personal testimonies, oral histories, and marginalised perspectives offers crucial insights into the human cost of political decisions and the enduring shadow that Partition continues to cast over the Indian subcontinent. The process of acknowledging and confronting this painful past remains essential for fostering reconciliation and building a more inclusive future.
Which of the following statements accurately represent the objectives the passage suggests for understanding the complexities of Partition?
To merely highlight the political outcomes of Partition.
To solely blame one nation for the unrest and violence.
To critically engage with diverse experiences and acknowledge multifaceted violence.
To promote a simplistic narrative of good versus bad.
To ignore personal testimonies and marginalised perspectives in historical accounts.
151
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the given passage carefully to answer the following questions. Each question will have five alternatives as its answer. Choose the correct option as your answer.

The stroke of midnight, August 15, 1947, heralded the birth of two independent nations, India and Pakistan, carved out of the departing British Raj. Yet, this moment of triumph was inextricably intertwined with the agonising trauma of Partition. The Radcliffe Line, hastily drawn and based on inadequate demographic data, arbitrarily bisected provinces, communities, and even families, unleashing a maelstrom of violence, displacement, and enduring psychological scars. The immediate aftermath witnessed one of the largest forced migrations in human history. Millions of Hindus, Sikhs, and Muslims found themselves on the "wrong" side of the newly drawn border, compelled to abandon their ancestral homes and embark on perilous journeys to their perceived homelands. Trains became charnel houses, filled with the mutilated bodies of those targeted in the communal frenzy that gripped the subcontinent. Stories of unimaginable brutality – massacres, abduction, and sexual violence – became the horrific currency of this unprecedented upheaval, leaving an indelible mark on the collective psyche of generations to come.
Beyond the immediate bloodshed, the legacy of Partition continues to manifest in complex and often contentious ways. The arbitrary division sowed the seeds of enduring geopolitical rivalry between India and Pakistan, marked by territorial disputes, proxy wars, and a persistent climate of mistrust. The unresolved issue of Kashmir remains a potent flashpoint, a constant reminder of ________________. Furthermore, within the successor states, the narratives of Partition remain deeply fragmented and often politicised. Official histories frequently emphasise nationalistic perspectives, often downplaying or selectively highlighting the violence and suffering experienced by certain communities. Subaltern voices, particularly those of women and marginalised groups who bore a disproportionate burden of the violence, have historically been silenced or relegated to the periphery. The intergenerational trauma, passed down through families and communities, continues to influence social relations and individual identities. The Partition era also left behind a complex tapestry of cultural and linguistic fragmentation. Shared histories and intertwined traditions were abruptly severed. The loss of heritage, the destruction of cultural artefacts, and the forced separation of artistic and intellectual communities had a profound impact on the cultural landscape of the subcontinent. The debates surrounding national identity in both India and Pakistan are still deeply influenced by the experience of Partition and the need to reconcile competing narratives of belonging and victimhood. Understanding the complexities of Partition requires moving beyond simplistic narratives of victim and perpetrator. It demands a critical engagement with the diverse experiences of those who lived through it, acknowledging the multifaceted nature of the violence and its long-term consequences. Examining personal testimonies, oral histories, and marginalised perspectives offers crucial insights into the human cost of political decisions and the enduring shadow that Partition continues to cast over the Indian subcontinent. The process of acknowledging and confronting this painful past remains essential for fostering reconciliation and building a more inclusive future.
Which of the following accurately state the passage's objectives for fostering reconciliation and building a more inclusive future?
Overlooking the traumatic experiences of displaced populations.
Minimizing the cultural and linguistic fragmentation caused by Partition.
Acknowledging and confronting the painful past through critical engagement.
Emphasizing only the nationalistic perspectives in official histories.
Celebrating the economic rivalry between India and Pakistan.

Directions: Given below is a set of six sentences, which when properly sequenced, form a comprehensible paragraph. The third sentence is fixed while the rest of the sentences are jumbled up. Arrange the sentences in the correct sequence and answer the questions that follow.

A. The ongoing conflict has resulted in significant humanitarian concerns, including limited access to essential resources and frequent ______ of civilian populations.

B. The Gaza Strip is a Palestinian territory that borders Israel, Egypt, and the Mediterranean Sea.

C. The region has been a focal point of the broader Israeli-Palestinian conflict for decades.

D. This situation is further complicated by the involvement of various international actors and differing perspectives on the root causes of the conflict.

E. The blockade imposed on Gaza has severely restricted the movement of people and goods, impacting the lives of its residents.

F. The Israeli-Palestinian conflict is a complex and deeply rooted issue with historical, political, and religious dimensions.

There is a blank in the sentence 'A', which of the following is the most appropriate word to fill in the blank?

I disturbance

II displacement

III celebration

Both I & II
Only I
Only II
Only III
Both II & III

161
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct/most appropriate options: 

In a worrying trend, the registration of violent crimes such as rape, kidnapping, atrocities against children, robberies, and murders increased in 2021 to levels set before the pandemic, in comparison to the drop in 2020, according to the annual report, “Crime in India” released by the NCRB earlier this week. The drop, in 2020, seemed to, therefore, be an anomaly, either due to lowered registration or a partial decrease in occurrence as there were extensive lockdowns and office shutdowns. While there was an increase in violent crimes in 2021, the overall crime rate (per one lakh people) decreased from 487.8 in 2020 to 445.9 in 2021, largely due to a decrease in cases registered under disobedience to a public servant’s order, relating to the lockdowns. If 2020 was the year when India faced the first COVID-19 wave, 2021 was equally a fraught year because of the effect of the Delta variant of the novel coronavirus; the frequency and intensity of the lockdowns were relatively lower in comparison to 2020. “Cruelty by husband or his relatives” constituted 31.8% of crimes against women, up from 30.2% in 2020 and 30.9% in 2019, indicating that domestic violence continued to be a major issue. While violent crimes increased, the charge sheeting rate fell from 75.8% in 2020 to 72.3% in 2021, as did the conviction rate (57% from 59.2% in 2020). So, law enforcement was less responsive in a year _______ more violent crimes. Again these trends have to be read State-wise — Assam (76.6 violent crimes per one lakh people), Delhi (57), and West Bengal (48.7) had the highest numbers while Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, and Tamil Nadu registered the lowest numbers.

The report also revealed that the suicide rate in the population in 2021 — 12 per one lakh people were the highest in the last five years. Domestic problems (33.2%) and illnesses (18.6%) were reported as the main reasons, with most victims being daily wage earners (25.6%) and housewives (14.1%), revealing the severity of the pandemic and its indirect consequences on people. With India registering the highest number of excess deaths during the pandemic, in particular during the Delta wave according to the World Health Organization, these figures are not surprising. The 5.9% jump in cases registered as cyber crimes over 2020, also indicates the increasing use of digital devices and the related challenges. This increase was more so in rural areas as cyber crime in metropolitan cities (with a population of more than two million people) registered a decline of 8.3% compared to 2020. With more people in rural areas utilizing digital devices, including for financial purposes, the increase in cybercrimes should warrant an effort by the Government to educate people about risks in cyber activities and to ensure better law enforcement.

What is the central theme of the passage?
Decrease in violent crimes, suicides in 2021.
Increase in violent crimes, suicides in 2020.
Increase in violent crimes, suicides in 2019.
Increase in violent crimes, suicides in 2021.
Reduction in violent crimes, suicides in 2021.
162
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct/most appropriate options: 

In a worrying trend, the registration of violent crimes such as rape, kidnapping, atrocities against children, robberies, and murders increased in 2021 to levels set before the pandemic, in comparison to the drop in 2020, according to the annual report, “Crime in India” released by the NCRB earlier this week. This increase was more so in rural areas as cyber crime in metropolitan cities (with a population of more than two million people) registered a decline of 8.3% compared to 2020. With more people in rural areas utilizing digital devices, including for financial purposes, the increase in cybercrimes should warrant an effort by the Government to educate people about risks in cyber activities and to ensure better law enforcement.

30.2%
31.8%
30.9%
25.6%
14.1%

Which of the following is/are correct according to the given passage?

A. India registered the highest number of excess deaths during the pandemic, according to the World Health Organization.

B. There was a huge decrease in violent crimes in 2021.

C. The charge sheeting rate has risen in 2021 as compared to 2020.

Only A
Both A and B
Only B
Both B and C
Only C

In a worrying trend, the registration of violent crimes such as rape, kidnapping, atrocities against children, robberies, and murders increased in 2021 to levels set before the pandemic, in comparison to the drop in 2020, according to the annual report, “Crime in India” released by the NCRB earlier this week. English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct/most appropriate options: 

In a worrying trend, the registration of violent crimes such as rape, kidnapping, atrocities against children, robberies, and murders increased in 2021 to levels set before the pandemic, in comparison to the drop in 2020, according to the annual report, “Crime in India” released by the NCRB earlier this week. The drop, in 2020, seemed to, therefore, be an anomaly, either due to lowered registration or a partial decrease in occurrence as there were extensive lockdowns and office shutdowns. While there was an increase in violent crimes in 2021, the overall crime rate (per one lakh people) decreased from 487.8 in 2020 to 445.9 in 2021, largely due to a decrease in cases registered under disobedience to a public servant’s order, relating to the lockdowns. If 2020 was the year when India faced the first COVID-19 wave, 2021 was equally a fraught year because of the effect of the Delta variant of the novel coronavirus; the frequency and intensity of the lockdowns were relatively lower in comparison to 2020. “Cruelty by husband or his relatives” constituted 31.8% of crimes against women, up from 30.2% in 2020 and 30.9% in 2019, indicating that domestic violence continued to be a major issue. While violent crimes increased, the charge sheeting rate fell from 75.8% in 2020 to 72.3% in 2021, as did the conviction rate (57% from 59.2% in 2020). So, law enforcement was less responsive in a year _______ more violent crimes. Again these trends have to be read State-wise — Assam (76.6 violent crimes per one lakh people), Delhi (57), and West Bengal (48.7) had the highest numbers while Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, and Tamil Nadu registered the lowest numbers.

The report also revealed that the suicide rate in the population in 2021 — 12 per one lakh people were the highest in the last five years. Domestic problems (33.2%) and illnesses (18.6%) were reported as the main reasons, with most victims being daily wage earners (25.6%) and housewives (14.1%), revealing the severity of the pandemic and its indirect consequences on people. With India registering the highest number of excess deaths during the pandemic, in particular during the Delta wave according to the World Health Organization, these figures are not surprising. The 5.9% jump in cases registered as cyber crimes over 2020, also indicates the increasing use of digital devices and the related challenges. This increase was more so in rural areas as cyber crime in metropolitan cities (with a population of more than two million people) registered a decline of 8.3% compared to 2020. With more people in rural areas utilizing digital devices, including for financial purposes, the increase in cybercrimes should warrant an effort by the Government to educate people about risks in cyber activities and to ensure better law enforcement.

What will fit in the blank taken from the passage: ''So, law enforcement was less responsive in a year _______ more violent crimes.''
Of
With
For
From
On
167
English Language
+0.5s, -0.125s

Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct/most appropriate options: 

In a worrying trend, the registration of violent crimes such as rape, kidnapping, atrocities against children, robberies, and murders increased in 2021 to levels set before the pandemic, in comparison to the drop in 2020, according to the annual report, “Crime in India” released by the NCRB earlier this week. The drop, in 2020, seemed to, therefore, be an anomaly, either due to lowered registration or a partial decrease in occurrence as there were extensive lockdowns and office shutdowns. While there was an increase in violent crimes in 2021, the overall crime rate (per one lakh people) decreased from 487.8 in 2020 to 445.9 in 2021, largely due to a decrease in cases registered under disobedience to a public servant’s order, relating to the lockdowns. If 2020 was the year when India faced the first COVID-19 wave, 2021 was equally a fraught year because of the effect of the Delta variant of the novel coronavirus; the frequency and intensity of the lockdowns were relatively lower in comparison to 2020. “Cruelty by husband or his relatives” constituted 31.8% of crimes against women, up from 30.2% in 2020 and 30.9% in 2019, indicating that domestic violence continued to be a major issue. While violent crimes increased, the charge sheeting rate fell from 75.8% in 2020 to 72.3% in 2021, as did the conviction rate (57% from 59.2% in 2020). Again these trends have to be read State-wise — Assam (76.6 violent crimes per one lakh people), Delhi (57), and West Bengal (48.7) had the highest numbers while Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, and Tamil Nadu registered the lowest numbers.

The report also revealed that the suicide rate in the population in 2021 — 12 per one lakh people were the highest in the last five years. This increase was more so in rural areas as cyber crime in metropolitan cities (with a population of more than two million people) registered a decline of 8.3% compared to 2020. With more people in rural areas utilizing digital devices, including for financial purposes, the increase in cybercrimes should warrant an effort by the Government to educate people about risks in cyber activities and to ensure better law enforcement.

In this question, a sentence (in bold) from the passage has been divided into five parts (A), (B), (C), (D), and (E). Read the sentence to find out whether there is any grammatical error in it. The error if any, will be in one part of the sentence. If there is no error, the answer is 'No error'. Ignore the error of punctuation if any.

The report also revealed (A)/ that the suicide rate in the (B)/ population in 2021 — 12 per one lakh people were (C)/ the highest in the last five years. (D)/ No error (E)

A
B
C
D
E

Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct/most appropriate options: 

In a worrying trend, the registration of violent crimes such as rape, kidnapping, atrocities against children, robberies, and murders increased in 2021 to levels set before the pandemic, in comparison to the drop in 2020, according to the annual report, “Crime in India” released by the NCRB earlier this week. The drop, in 2020, seemed to, therefore, be an anomaly, either due to lowered registration or a partial decrease in occurrence as there were extensive lockdowns and office shutdowns. While there was an increase in violent crimes in 2021, the overall crime rate (per one lakh people) decreased from 487.8 in 2020 to 445.9 in 2021, largely due to a decrease in cases registered under disobedience to a public servant’s order, relating to the lockdowns. If 2020 was the year when India faced the first COVID-19 wave, 2021 was equally a fraught year because of the effect of the Delta variant of the novel coronavirus; the frequency and intensity of the lockdowns were relatively lower in comparison to 2020. “Cruelty by husband or his relatives” constituted 31.8% of crimes against women, up from 30.2% in 2020 and 30.9% in 2019, indicating that domestic violence continued to be a major issue. While violent crimes increased, the charge sheeting rate fell from 75.8% in 2020 to 72.3% in 2021, as did the conviction rate (57% from 59.2% in 2020). So, law enforcement was less responsive in a year _______ more violent crimes. Again these trends have to be read State-wise — Assam (76.6 violent crimes per one lakh people), Delhi (57), and West Bengal (48.7) had the highest numbers while Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, and Tamil Nadu registered the lowest numbers.

The report also revealed that the suicide rate in the population in 2021 — 12 per one lakh people were the highest in the last five years. Domestic problems (33.2%) and illnesses (18.6%) were reported as the main reasons, with most victims being daily wage earners (25.6%) and housewives (14.1%), revealing the severity of the pandemic and its indirect consequences on people. With India registering the highest number of excess deaths during the pandemic, in particular during the Delta wave according to the World Health Organization, these figures are not surprising. The 5.9% jump in cases registered as cyber crimes over 2020, also indicates the increasing use of digital devices and the related challenges. This increase was more so in rural areas as cyber crime in metropolitan cities (with a population of more than two million people) registered a decline of 8.3% compared to 2020. With more people in rural areas utilizing digital devices, including for financial purposes, the increase in cybercrimes should warrant an effort by the Government to educate people about risks in cyber activities and to ensure better law enforcement.

Select the word from the passage that can be used as a one-word substitute for the given group of words.

Filled with something unpleasant

Atrocities
Violent
Disobedience
Fraught
Intensity

English Language

Directions: Read the passage given below and answer the questions that follow by choosing the correct/most appropriate options: 

In a worrying trend, the registration of violent crimes such as rape, kidnapping, atrocities against children, robberies, and murders increased in 2021 to levels set before the pandemic, in comparison to the drop in 2020, according to the annual report, “Crime in India” released by the NCRB earlier this week. The drop, in 2020, seemed to, therefore, be an anomaly, either due to lowered registration or a partial decrease in occurrence as there were extensive lockdowns and office shutdowns. While there was an increase in violent crimes in 2021, the overall crime rate (per one lakh people) decreased from 487.8 in 2020 to 445.9 in 2021, largely due to a decrease in cases registered under disobedience to a public servant’s order, relating to the lockdowns. If 2020 was the year when India faced the first COVID-19 wave, 2021 was equally a fraught year because of the effect of the Delta variant of the novel coronavirus; the frequency and intensity of the lockdowns were relatively lower in comparison to 2020. “Cruelty by husband or his relatives” constituted 31.8% of crimes against women, up from 30.2% in 2020 and 30.9% in 2019, indicating that domestic violence continued to be a major issue. While violent crimes increased, the charge sheeting rate fell from 75.8% in 2020 to 72.3% in 2021, as did the conviction rate (57% from 59.2% in 2020). So, law enforcement was less responsive in a year _______ more violent crimes. Again these trends have to be read State-wise — Assam (76.6 violent crimes per one lakh people), Delhi (57), and West Bengal (48.7) had the highest numbers while Gujarat, Andhra Pradesh, and Tamil Nadu registered the lowest numbers.

The report also revealed that the suicide rate in the population in 2021 — 12 per one lakh people were the highest in the last five years. Domestic problems (33.2%) and illnesses (18.6%) were reported as the main reasons, with most victims being daily wage earners (25.6%) and housewives (14.1%), revealing the severity of the pandemic and its indirect consequences on people. With India registering the highest number of excess deaths during the pandemic, in particular during the Delta wave according to the World Health Organization, these figures are not surprising. The 5.9% jump in cases registered as cyber crimes over 2020, also indicates the increasing use of digital devices and the related challenges. This increase was more so in rural areas as cyber crime in metropolitan cities (with a population of more than two million people) registered a decline of 8.3% compared to 2020. With more people in rural areas utilizing digital devices, including for financial purposes, the increase in cybercrimes should warrant an effort by the Government to educate people about risks in cyber activities and to ensure better law enforcement.

Choose the synonym of the word 'Extensive'.
Profound
Limited
Restricted
Circumscribed
Finite

With more people in rural areas utilizing digital devices, including for financial purposes, the increase in cybercrimes should warrant an effort by the Government to educate people about risks in cyber activities and to ensure better law enforcement.

Choose the antonym of the word 'Anomaly'.
Oddity
Peculiarity
Aberration
Exception
Ordinary
